member.summary: Abstract base class for event data for publish and un-publish events.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.Extensibility.Events.PublishOrUnPublishEventArgs.DeepCopy
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the event data which can be used for asynchronous events.
member.returns: A new -derived instance which is a deep copy of this one.
member.remarks: Asynchronous events are executed on a different thread and should also be completely decoupled from the synchronous event chain. That is: asynchronous event handlers should not have the ability to change the event data used for the synchronous events. Since the asynchronous event handlers may be executed in parallel, the event data used for the asynchronous events is a deep copy. The default implementation performs a shallow copy, which is OK as long as the class only contains value type properties. Subclasses that add reference type properties must override this method to ensure the deep copy semantics.

member.summary: Gets a string representation of the object.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Extensibility.Events.PublishOrUnPublishEventArgs.Items
member.summary: Gets the items that are to be (un-)published.
member.remarks: The PublishEngine.Publish and PublishEngine.UnPublish methods can be called with multiple items. Eventually, these items will get published in one Publish Transaction (for now, separate Publish Transactions are created for each item). A separate Publish Event is raised for each item, but each event will have all items in its event data. This is a read only property allowing event handlers to see which items are part of the publish job.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.PublishInstructionBase.ResolveInstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets the .

remarks.para: The class features the property that allows the user to indicate the purpose of the Resolving Operation. However, when using a subclass of , the class itself already defines the purpose (or sets some limitations on what it is allowed to be). For example, the class already indicates that the resolving purpose is while the class dictates that the resolving purpose can be either or .

When you set this property, you need to make sure that the is not set or that it will be set to a value that is accepted by this Publish Instruction. The same applies when changing the property of this Publish Instruction's Resolve Instruction. In both cases, an will be thrown if the Purpose defined in this object's ResolveInstruction property is not compatible with this object.

member.exception: when trying to set the property to null
when trying to directly or indirectly change the Purpose of this object's ResolveInstruction to an incompatible value

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.PublishTransaction.Undo(Tridion.ContentManager.Queuing.QueueMessagePriority)
member.summary: Undoes the Publish Transaction.
member.param: The priority used for queuing the undo request.

remarks.para: Undoing a Publish transaction will result in the system trying to pretend that this publish transaction did not happen. If items were overwritten by subsequent Publish Transactions then they will not be modified.

This is an asynchronous operation, and the method will return as soon as the Undo request is queued. The Publish Transaction can be read again to determine if the Undo was successful or not, by looking at the . Further details about the individual items can be found in .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.PublishTransaction.Delete
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item or a specific version of the item from the system.

remarks.para: The object should not be used anymore after this method has been called.

For an instance of a class that derives from , the version that is loaded into the instance is taken into account. If the latest version of the item is loaded without a version specified in the , the item will be fully deleted. If a specific version of the item is loaded, only that version will be deleted.
If the object being deleted is a , the method offers more control over the handling of the keyword's descendants. The method is the equivalent of calling method with an argument value of .
If the object being deleted is a , the delete event will be raised only for item itself and not for child items.

member.exception: The instance represents the latest version. The instance was created using a that specifies the latest version.
The instance is checked-out.
The instance is a root Structure Group in a parent Publication of a BluePrint hierarchy.
The instance is a root Folder.
The item is localized in another Publication in the BluePrint hierarchy.
The item is published.
The instance is localized.
The instance is shared.
The user does not have Delete permissions or appropriate rights.
The embedded instance is included or imported by another Schema.
The item is in use by another item.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.IncludeComponentLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component links should also be resolved.
member.remarks: If the value is true, component links in fields of components are checked and if a component holds a component link towards a component that is being resolved, that component gets resolved also, but only if it is published.
member.example: Schema S has a Component Link field. Component B is based on schema S and has a component link that links to component A. Component B is published. Component A is based on another schema that has only a text field. If we resolve component A with set to true, then the result is that both A and B will be included in the resolved items, because B holds a component link to A and B is published. However, if we resolve component B with set to false, then the result is that only B will be included in the resolved items, because there are no components having a component link towards B.
member.value: true if component links should also be resolved; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.IncludeChildPublications
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resolve items also from child publications.
member.value: true if items from child publications should also be resolved; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.IncludeWorkflow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is published from the user's work list.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.OnlyPublishedItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether resolving should only return already published items.
member.value: true if only published items should be resolved; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is obsolete and it has been replaced by . Please use that property instead. Using and together is not supported.
When resolving a component which is part of a dynamic component presentation, it will always be resolved regardless of the value of this property.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.StructureResolveOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the option to include the resolved items and/or structure.
member.value: Choose when only items should be resolved excluding the Structure. This is the default option. Choose when only the Structure should be resolved. Choose when Structure along with items should be resolved.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.Publishing.ResolveInstruction.Purpose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the purpose of the resolving operation.

remarks.para: This property supersedes the legacy property .

This property affects the resolving operation, taking into account the publish state of the items being resolved. The only option that ignores the publish state is . Furthermore, resolving with will not resolve any items that can remain in their current publish state after the resolved items will have been un-published. For example, resolving a Page with will not resolve its Structure Group, because there might be another Page (not being resolved) that is contained in the same Structure Group. Additionally, the Structure Group can continue to remain published, even if it doesn't contain any published Pages. In the opposite example, resolving a Structure Group with will also resolve any published Pages contained in it, because these Pages cannot remain published if the Structure Group will be un-published.

Not all values of the enumeration are valid when the Resolve Instruction is used in combination with the class. The class and its descendants can internally pose limitations on the allowed values that the Purpose property can have. Please consult the documentation of for further information.
